           Online Offerings            Diploma Program            Admissions                                                                                                   Undergraduate Programs                                                      Paul McGhee Division        Whether you are considering returning to school to obtain a degree, are venturing into higher education for the first time, or are transferring from a community college or a four-year institution of higher learning, the NYU School of Professional Studies Paul McGhee Division offers a wide selection of bachelor's and associate's degree programs to suit your needs.   McGhee programs provide an undergraduate education that will serve you a lifetime. They prepare you for careers in emerging industries, provide a strong background in the liberal arts and sciences, and offer a solid foundation for admission to graduate school.           Expand All   Collapse All          Bachelor's Degrees                                                                                              Associate's Degrees                                                                                              Schack Institute of Real Estate        The NYU School of Professional Studies Schack Institute of Real Estate is uniquely positioned as one of the top academically based real estate programs in the country and students enrolled in its programs benefit tremendously from its location in New York City, the capital of real estate investing.   The Schack Institute of Real Estate offers an undergraduate degree that is specifically designed to meet the needs of traditional students who want to study full time, during the day. The program combines a rigorous liberal arts education, taught by noted experts in the field, with comprehensive exposure to many facets of the real estate industry.              Bachelor's Degree          B.S. in Real Estate             Tisch Center for Hospitality and Tourism        Located in the heart of New York City—the epicenter of the hospitality and tourism business—the NYU School of Professional Studies Tisch Center for Hospitality and Tourism prepares you to learn and to thrive in a dynamic and competitive global environment—one that both embraces and embodies the consumer experience.   As an undergraduate student, you will gain the knowledge and the skill sets to work in these industries, or to pursue a graduate education. The Tisch Center undergraduate degree provides grounding in theory and in practice, ensuring that your education meets and exceeds industry standards.              Bachelor's Degree                                                                                            Tisch Institute for Sports Management, Media, and Business        With the New York metropolitan area being home to numerous world-renown franchises and sports television networks, and being the headquarters of five major sporting leagues, there isn’t a better location to study the sports industry.   Our undergraduate degree offers a challenging, interdisciplinary curriculum, coupled with the opportunity to interact with industry leaders and faculty members renowned in their fields, and enables students to build the skill sets necessary to embark on an exceptional career in sports management.                             Degree Programs                                            Degree Programs ›                Graduate Programs            Undergraduate Programs            Online Offerings            Diploma Program            Admissions                                                                                    Graduate Degree Programs    The NYU School of Professional Studies offers a variety of graduate degree and certificate programs that are designed to help students to enhance their current professional credentials, or to launch or change careers. Faculty members are renowned experts in their fields, who bring a wealth of current industry information and networking opportunities to their classroom teaching. Academic programs offer a comprehensive core in their area of specialization that is complemented by an array of concentrations from which to choose.         Learn More            Undergraduate Degree Programs    The NYU School of Professional Studies Paul McGhee Division programs provide an undergraduate education that is stimulating, practically oriented, and attuned to your needs. The core curriculum affords a broad conceptual understanding and critical insights—in science, history, culture, and the arts, while specialized majors and concentrations prepare you for the challenges of the workplace. Rigorous academics, professionally focused internships and study abroad opportunities make for a well-rounded, highly valued education.          Learn More             Online Offerings    Whether you are living in New York City or anywhere around the globe, you can take advantage of all that the NYU School of Professional Studies has to offer by enrolling in one of our online undergraduate degrees, graduate degrees and certificates, or noncredit courses and certificates. Online learning options are available 24/7, and provide course content that is challenging, professionally oriented, conveniently scheduled, and highly interactive. Stern School of Business        Liberal Studies Program      NYU Abu Dhabi      NYU Shanghai      Polytechnic School of Engineering      Robert F. Wagner Graduate School of Public Service          School of Continuing and Professional Studies      School of Law        School of Medicine      Silver School of Social Work      Steinhardt School of Culture, Education, and Human Development      Tisch School of the Arts                                             Search      go                                                New York University              New York University              University Registrar                                                     Calendars                             Course Search                             Registration                             Academic Records                              Graduation                                          Expected Term of Graduation                How To Apply                Graduation Deadlines                Diplomas                Graduation Honors                Founders' Day Award                Graduation Rates                Degree Progress                                                                   Veterans Benefits                             University Policies & FERPA                          Forms & Procedures                          Training Guides                         Home          |         Graduation             |          Degree Progress                                    Academic Advisement Report               The Academic Advisement Report is a computerized degree audit report that tracks a student's progress towards the completion of degree requirements. The report displays the courses that can be selected from to complete specific requirements and how the courses taken, including transfer, and test credit, apply towards degree requirements. The report assumes successful completion of all course work in progress and takes into consideration approved substitutions, waivers and degree exceptions. As requirements are completed, they are collapsed within the report and only outstanding requirements remain expanded.    The Advisement Report can be accessed by selecting "Academic Requirements" from the drop down menu in Albert. A "What-if Report" can also be selected to enable students to run a degree audit report based on what-if situations, such as, a potential course selection, grade, or to be audited against a completely different set of degree, major, and/or minor requirements.    The purpose of the Advisement Report is to enhance advising by providing accurate and comprehensive information that can be used in consultation with an advisor to make course selection decisions. It is an unofficial document and should be used as an advisement tool that should not take the place of meetings with an academic advisor. All students are encouraged to contact their advisor for academic and career counseling. Additionally, an advisor will be able to anticipate problems and make adjustments to a program, when necessary.    It is important that students in the undergraduate schools consult their Academic Advisement Report in Albert to monitor their progress toward the academic program they intend to complete. Contact your advisor immediately if you believe there are any errors or discrepancies in the report or if you need to request a waiver or substitution to satisfy your program.    IF YOU EXPECT TO GRADUATE THIS SEMESTER: Please remember to view your Academic Advisement Report to ensure that all academic requirements will be satisfied by the end of the term, so that you may graduate on time. Make sure that all Dean or Departmental waivers, exemptions or substitutions are submitted to the Registrar no later than the close of the term or you will be ineligible to graduate and will have to postpone your graduation for another semester.
